org.deeplearning4j.nn.layers.feedforward.embedding

Class EmbeddingLayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.deeplearning4j.nn.layers.BaseLayer<EmbeddingLayer>
      • org.deeplearning4j.nn.layers.feedforward.embedding.EmbeddingLayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Layer, Model

    public class EmbeddingLayer
extends BaseLayer<EmbeddingLayer>
    Embedding layer: feed-forward layer that expects single integers per example as input (class numbers, in range 0 to numClass-1) as input. This input has shape [numExamples,1] instead of [numExamples,numClasses] for the equivalent one-hot representation. Mathematically, EmbeddingLayer is equivalent to using a DenseLayer with a one-hot representation for the input; however, it can be much more efficient with a large number of classes (as a dense layer + one-hot input does a matrix multiply with all but one value being zero).
    Note: can only be used as the first layer for a network
    Note 2: For a given example index i, the output is activationFunction(weights.getRow(i) + bias), hence the weight rows can be considered a vector/embedding for each example.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • backpropGradient

        public Pair<Gradient,INDArray> backpropGradient(INDArray epsilon)
        Description copied from interface: Layer
        Calculate the gradient relative to the error in the next layer
        Specified by:
        backpropGradient in interface Layer
        Overrides:
        backpropGradient in class BaseLayer<EmbeddingLayer>
        Parameters:
        epsilon - w^(L+1)*delta^(L+1). Or, equiv: dC/da, i.e., (dC/dz)*(dz/da) = dC/da, where C is cost function a=sigma(z) is activation.
        Returns:
        Pair where Gradient is gradient for this layer, INDArray is epsilon needed by next layer, but before element-wise multiply by sigmaPrime(z). So for standard feed-forward layer, if this layer is L, then return.getSecond() == (w^(L)*(delta^(L))^T)^T

      • preOutput

        public INDArray preOutput(boolean training)
        Description copied from class: BaseLayer
        Classify input
        Specified by:
        preOutput in interface Layer
        Overrides:
        preOutput in class BaseLayer<EmbeddingLayer>
        Parameters:
        training - the input (can either be a matrix or vector) If it's a matrix, each row is considered an example and associated rows are classified accordingly. Each row will be the likelihood of a label given that example
        Returns:
        a probability distribution for each row
